duties_responsibilities.duty: Participate in the development and measurement of quality improvement programs and processes.
Monitor member health outcomes through internal and external data collection for determining effectiveness of care environments.
Support clinical and regulatory aspects of quality improvement and patient safety projects.
Promote patient safety by increasing awareness and sharing information with stakeholders.
Perform Inter-Rater Reliability (IRR) and manage current quality initiatives.
Provide clinical and regulatory knowledge and skills to ongoing quality improvement initiatives.
Perform other related duties as required or assigned.

education_certification.credential: Active California RN license without restriction.
Minimum three years of experience with clinical quality improvement in health-related setting.
Clinical knowledge and critical thinking skills.
Knowledge of managed care principles and practices.
Valid California driver’s license and acceptable driving record.
Working knowledge of and the ability to efficiently operate all applicable computer software.
Ability to think and work effectively under pressure and accurately prioritize and complete tasks within established timeframes.
